Name: Hybrid seeds
Description: Using hybrid seeds can increase yields and resist pests and diseases.

Name: Precision agriculture
Description: Using technology such as GPS, sensors, and drones to precisely monitor and manage crops.

Name: Irrigation management
Description: Efficient use of water resources through techniques such as drip irrigation and sprinkler systems.

Name: Crop rotation
Description: Alternating crops in a specific sequence to maintain soil health and reduce pest and disease pressure.

Name: Cover crops
Description: Planting crops to cover the soil between main crops to improve soil health and reduce erosion.

Name: Integrated Pest Management
Description: A combination of biological, cultural, and chemical methods to control pests in a sustainable manner.

Name: Fertigation
Description: The application of fertilizers through irrigation systems to increase nutrient efficiency.

Name: Conservation tillage
Description: Minimal soil disturbance to reduce erosion and increase soil health.

Name: Vertical Farming
Description: The use of indoor, controlled environments to grow crops in stacked layers.

Name: Precision Livestock Farming
Description: Using technology to monitor and manage livestock health, nutrition, and environment.

Name: No-till farming
Description: Minimizing soil disturbance to improve soil health and reduce erosion.

Name: Precision nutrient management
Description: Using technology to precisely monitor soil and plant nutrient levels to improve fertilizer efficiency.

Name: Climate-controlled greenhouses
Description: Using greenhouses to control the growing environment and extend the growing season.

Name: Soil health management
Description: Implementing practices to improve soil structure, fertility, and water-holding capacity.

Name: Remote sensing
Description: Using satellite and aerial imagery to monitor crops and identify areas in need of attention.

Name: Livestock genetics
Description: Using genetic selection to improve the health and productivity of livestock.

Name: Renewable energy in agriculture
Description: Implementing renewable energy sources such as solar and wind power to reduce energy costs and emissions.

Name: Autonomous tractors
Description: Using self-driving tractors to increase efficiency and reduce labor costs.

Name: Smart irrigation
Description: Using sensors and computer algorithms to optimize irrigation schedules and reduce water waste.

Name: Artificial intelligence in agriculture
Description: Using AI algorithms to make predictions, detect issues, and improve decision-making in agriculture.
